The Dai-Katana is a fearsome weapon that can slice through even the best armour and can cleave past even the staunchest defences. Here, a team of Tsaesci swordmasters train warriors how to best utilise these terrifying swords to great effect.

Undead warriors possess unyielding ferocity and wield a variety of weapons, including swords, bows, axes and spears. This elaborate underground network of burial chambers and catacombs is the preferred haunt for many of these fearsome troops when they are not summoned to fight.
Low palisades not only prevent thieves from stealing your cattle but they are also a small nuisance to the would be invaders who will need to jump over it.
A higher palisade will stop the invaders from jumping over but can still be destroyed in a short time with axemen hacking at it or with a well placed fireball.
A low wall made of earth it is an improvement over palisades.
The earth wall of the castle is now high enough to force the enemy to build ladders.
A crude stone wall is the first step in the right direction in proper siege defence but won't stand long against an army well equipped with siege engines.
Your stone wall is now reinforced and proper it will withstand much more damage against enemies siege engines and your soldiers will be able to give the enemy trying to take the walls a hard time.
Enchanted with magical runes these walls protect against attacks both material and magical. With powerful magick at work even the Daedric siege engines have little hope of doing damage to your walls!
A small weaponsmith shop that produces weapons in low quantities.
A medium sized weaponsmithy that makes most if not all of the weapons for your castle.
A large weaponsmith provides you with an ample supply of weapons so you can arm a small army.

Outfitting an entire castle or even an army is not enough for you because you are bent on conquering Mundus and carving out your own empire. For that you need armies and this is the place to supply several armies with weapons.

The White-Gold Tower is an ancient Aldmer structure built during the first era in imitation of Ada-mantia. Originally a Temple dedicated to the worship of "the Ancestors", the Tower was adapted into use as the Palace of the Alessian Empire, and later the Reman Empire that followed. It traditionally houses, amongst other things, the Ruby Throne and the Elder Scrolls.
The Palace of the Kings, built by Ysgramor and his Five Hundred companions after they conquered Skyrim from the Falmer. Some scholars say that they used Snow Elf slaves to build it.
A local chapter of the renowned Fighters Guild in the castle will bolster your forces with additional troops.
An outpost of the Union of the Iron Hilts provides trained soldiers to the levy.
A supplementary hall belonging to the legendary Companions, tracing their legacy back to the Companions of Ysgramor. Tough, hardy warriors eager for glory in battle stand at your command.
The Mages Guild of Tamriel has many small chapters across the continent, serving as centers of magical study and training.
The mysterious Transcendent Architects of Akavir are known to study in remote towers. This group, however, appears to have been persuaded to take residence in a more populated location.
The Administrative Center provides a - as the name would imply - centralized location for bureaucrats, magistrates, and administrators to deal in matters of trade and government.
The local ruler's membership in a diplomatic society has encouraged the creation of an Embassy, facilitating the spread of cultural exchange and easing diplomatic relations across the realm.

While this Hermitage is certainly not comparable to High Hrothgar, it maintains a small school of students of the Way of the Voice. Of course, in many cases, not all students are as true to the Way as their mentors would like. The result is a small but fierce group of battle-ready Tongues, eager to test their voices against the world.
All citizens are welcome in this barracks for the Elder Council's elite guards, at least on the first two floors.

Akaviri city militias are dependent upon cohesion in order to achieve victory. This truth is reflected in this training field where spearmen and archers are trained to fight together in complementary formations. They can rain down fire from afar, or present a wall of steel to deter an enemy charge.

Altmer soldiers are capable of fighting in the same styles as soldiers of other cultures, but many train specifically as mages to use their natural magical abilities. These quarters house mages who are professional and semi-professional soldiers, and who are highly skilled at protecting their city and fighting abroad.
A small public archery range where anyone who have equipment can practice their skills.
A medium sized public archery range where anyone who have equipment can practice their skills.
A large public archery range attracting people not only from the city itself, but also from nearby settlements both to practice their skills and to watch ,when there is an archery contest.

In Argonian cities, even militia fighters are expected to be competent with the spear in case their lands are beset by hostile forces, especially cavalry. Militia warriors receive ample practice with spear techniques at this drill yard.

This unassuming building provides basic weapons for Argonian townspeople in case of emergency. Whether their city is attacked or they are called upon to fight elsewhere, even the humblest able-bodied Argonians can and will battle with tenacity.
A basic armoury for outfitting a small amount of soldiers.
A full armoury for outfitting a good amount of soldiers.
An extended armoury, providing weapons and armour for a much larger fighting force.
A chamber used for containing local funds. Gold, jewels and other artifacts spill out of chests in this locked room.
An office where taxes of the city and surrounding land are collected. Offices maintain vital tax records to ensure all locals are up-to-date on fees, licenses and other expenses.
What was formally a locked treasure chamber is now protected by combination lock, storing the wealth of the city for use by local authorities.
The city's funds are carefully managed and dispersed by a local treasurer whose office and residence is one of the most stately buildings in the entire province.

The Ayleids have a knack for the arcane arts, and many Ayleid troops are trained specifically for their magical abilities. These quarters provide for a squadron of Ayleid mages who use their skills with spells to defend their allies and assail their enemies.
The Jaqspurs are Bosmer archers who excel in long-range combat. This barracks provides housing, training and equipment for these peerless bowmen.

A growing Breton city requires a large fighting force of mages to make the most of its people's abilities. Here, mages who make careers out of fighting are maintained for the defence of the city, and for the assistance of allied armies in the field.
Guard posts around bridges can keep the bridge safe from bandits and the occasional troll who may try to claim the bridge for themselves but not from an advancing army.
Guard houses built near bridges will allow for the stationing of more guards for an extended time.
Bridge guard towers will allow the bridge guard to spot an incoming enemy force from a distance long enough as to allow the defenders of the city an early warning.
Forts built near bridges can hold them against an advancing army long enough for a defending force to gather on the other bank.
A quarters reserved for the town guard.
A barracks where town guards live.
A barracks where city guards live.
The headquarters of the city guard is where they are coordinated from, both during a siege and in times of peace.
An entire fortress has been dedicated to the city guard, giving them a more defensible place to live and providing the city with an additional layer of defense.
Bridges leading to the gates will make the gates more defensible, forcing the enemy attacking the gates to come from a single direction and also bottlenecking them.
Drawbridges that can be raised during an attack on the city, leaving defenders on the other bank.
By encouraging the local population to invest in boats and go fishing near the city, we can ensure that there are always some boats that can be borrowed for military uses.
This is where the city's small naval force is docked while not on active duty.
The previous docks have been expanded, and are now capable of hosting a large naval force, ready to strike at a moment's notice.

Every great Velothi city is armed to the teeth, lest the inhabitants ever be forced to take up arms against Daedra, outlanders or even rivals from another Great House. This building houses full-time soldiers who wield spears and magic, and who can critically augment the local militia's fighting abilities.

Inhabitation of the City of Markarth predates that of the modern Reachmen or Nordic settlers. In ages past the City was a grand Citadel inhabited by the Dwemer, their great fortifications and many remaining structures a testament to their superior architectural prowess.

Dwemer citizens have great civic pride, and demonstrate it by joining armies as militia in times of war. This barracks is home to a squad of steadfast spearmen as well as a small group of mages who can offer arcane support in combat.
A public ground where people gather for fairs and other festivals.
A theater where accomplished thespians and aspiring playwrights can showcase their work.
A large amphitheater where the masses can gather to watch plays, poets, and musicians.
A great circus where animals from across Tamriel are showcased alongside acrobats and other acts.
Towers built on walls make them much more defensible during an attack.
Drainage is the removal of surface and subsurface water from the farming area to improve production and manage water supplies.
A water silo for storing water for use in farming, in case of a draught.
Irrigation is the artificial application of water to the land.
A small clearing of land used for farming.
Either because the farming is encouraged, or the land is good, or maybe because of both, farming is now widespread, with as many farms as the land allows.
Pastures used for grazing of cattle.
Farm estate is an estate built near a plantation owned by the family, housing many farmers who are, if the laws allow it, slaves of the family.
Public libraries are open to anyone, provided they know how to read.
An art school where various forms of art is taught, depending on the skills and interests of the students.
Writers guild, or more commonly known as scribes guild is a guild formed by scribes. Guilds were legalized by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate Versidius Shaie.

A bards college is where bards, poets and public speakers are trained. Bards are an important part of the Nord culture so it is not surprising that the most renowned college of bards is the Bards College of Solitude in Skyrim.
Gatehouses built above city gates make them more defensible.
Towers above the cities gates to allow an easily defensible gate.
A guild controlling hunting in the city's forest. Guilds were legalised by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate Versidius Shaie.
Masoners guild controls the practice of stonemasonry. Guilds were legalised by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate Versidius Shaie.
A guild controlling the practice of smithing. Guilds were legalised by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate Versidius Shaie.
A boatyard where trading ships are maintained and repaired of small damages.
Harbour cranes make loading and offloading of goods both easier and quicker.
A mill powered by the rising and lowering of the tides.
A repair docks where extensive repairs can be done for ships with serious damage caused by storms and pirate attacks alike.
These massive cranes need to be operated from multiple different stories because of their size.
These floodgates are used to insure that the harbor is not overtaken by the waters around it.
A storehouse to better protect goods from both the elements and thieves.
A depot where imported goods carried by ships wait to be approved by customs officers or goods that will be exported via sea routes wait for transportation.
This basic wooden pier can dock a few boats used for import and export.
A harbour has been built around the dock, allowing for more ships to bring their goods in and out of the province.
The harbour has attracted so many ships that the piers have been replaced with stone to allow heavier goods on them.
The harbour has been deepened to allow larger ships to dock.
The harbour has been dug partially into the city, creating canals where riverboats can take goods deeper into town.
This pier is specially constructed to allow locals and tourists alike the opportunity to enjoy a safe swim in local waters. Local businesses have cropped up nearby to serve this clientele.

Elite squads are the guards the city has to offer. Disciplined, well trained and well equipped, they are a force to be reckoned with in battle and more than a match to standard soldiery. This is their barracks.

Elite squads are the guards the city has to offer. Disciplined, well trained and well equipped, they are a force to be reckoned with in battle and more than a match to standard soldiery. This is their barracks.

Elite squads are the guards the city has to offer. Disciplined, well trained and well equipped, they are a force to be reckoned with in battle and more than a match to standard soldiery. This is their barracks.
This is where members of the elite squad, the best city's watch has to offer, train.
This is where members of the elite squad, the best city's watch has to offer, train.
An apothecary who makes healing materials.
An infirmary, staffed by a few healers, has been built here.
A full fledged hospital, with true doctors and expert healing mages, has been built here.
Imperial cities are constantly guarded by soldiers of the Legion. Heavily-armed patrol officers and elite garrison forces make their homes in these guard quarters.
Quarters dedicated to the city's infantry soldiers.
Quarters dedicated to the city's infantry soldiers.
Quarters dedicated to the city's infantry soldiers.
Quarters dedicated to the city's infantry soldiers.

The troops who defend Kamal cities are almost all infantry, favouring spears, axes, swords and other weapons that are effective in close-quarters or for defending narrow streets or mountain passes. A squad of such guards are trained and housed in this barracks.

Unlike the other peoples of Tamriel, the Khajiit do not use horses or other beasts for their cavalry. Instead, they rely on four of their quadrupedal phases - the Pahmar, Pahmar-Raht, Senche and Senche-Raht. This barracks offers living quarters for light and heavy "cavalry" alike.
These grounds are dedicated to refining the training of the local cavalry. Here, Khajiit cavalry practice their armour-fitting, hone their attack maneuvers and perfect their ferocious charges.
A school training mages in the ways of war magic. Even a small group of mages can have a profound impact on the battlefield.
A training yard devoted to mages. Mages require dedicated space to practice their arts to ensure that their deadly spells do not inflict collateral damage.
A barracks built to house mages skilled in warfare. This improves the city's ability to maintain magical fighters for protection.
The palace of the Mane of Elsweyr, where he commands over his subjects.
Here the town bakers made bread, pastries, and sweetrolls,(Don't let anyone steal yours)
Artisans here mold molten sand into glass.
In this part of the town furs, pelts, and cotton are sowed into various items.
Here blacksmiths work in hot forges moulding and smelting ore into weapons, jewellery and armour.

The snake magick that the Maormer practice allows them to charm and train vicious serpents into loyal guardians, beasts of burdens and mounts for their elite warriors. Here, a group of snake mages ply their craft to provide battle-ready serpents. These mages are also capable fighters and can assist in battle.
A small market square where vendors peddle their wares.
An arched passageway with shops on either side.
A farmers market where farmers from nearby villages sell their produce.
A grand bazaar where all kinds of goods are sold from stalls and tents.
Guilds were legalised by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate, Versidius Shaie. This guild controls commerce and trade within the city.
A house where unclaimed and unwanted items are sold to the highest bidder.
A complex where People of the province can store their gold and other valuables.
An advanced market has been built here where investors can see how their investments in various businesses are doing.
A militia force is a fighting force that is composed of non-professionals. This is their quarters.
A militia force is a fighting force that is composed of non-professionals. This is a small barracks used by them.
A militia force is a fighting force that is composed of non-professionals. This is a medium sized barracks used by them.
A militia is a fighting force that is composed of non-professionals. This is a large barracks used by them
The militia headquarters is where the city's militia forces are coordinated from.
Recruitment signs remind people there is always paid work as a soldier or guard.
Stands scattered around the city where recruiters let people know how glorious a life of a soldier is or how honourable it is to maintain order in the city as a guard.
Recruitment posts, opened in some parts of the city, allows those who are interested in joining the guards or the army to be accepted in to service.
Recruitment Bureau is where everything about the recruitment process is handled.
A milling stone, used for grinding wheat or other grains, is composed of two stones
column3: one stationary, bed stone, and another, running on top of the first, runner stone.

column2: A horse mill uses a horse to turn the runner stone, ensuring it turns faster and for a longer time, since horses won't tire out as easily.
A watermill, built near a moving water, uses a water turbine or water wheel to turn the millstone.
A large watermill, built near a moving water, uses a water turbine or water wheel to turn the millstone.
A windmill uses the energy of the wind to turn vanes called 'sails' or 'blades' which in turn move the milling stone.

A guild is an association of people of the same trade who control the practice of their craft in a particular settlement. This guild controls milling. Guilds were legalized by the Guilds Act that was passed by the Tsaesci Potentate Versidius Shaie.
An overshot mill is a more efficient watermill that uses an overshot wheel to power the process.
This mill has been industrialized, and grain is ground here in a factory like building.
A moat is a deep and wide ditch around your castle that will slow down the invaders.
A moat, flooded with water, will force the enemy to either take the bridges or build some themselves.
A small mustering ground for the militia where they practice military movements as in small forces.
A medium sized mustering ground allowing for a larger force of militia to practice military movements.
Large militia mustering grounds allow the entirety of your militia force to march and practice their military movements at the same time.
Night-watch posts built in more important parts of the city.
Night-watch posts are now widespread and are all around the city.
Night-watch posts have been replaced by small towers in more important locations.
All of the night-watch posts have now been replaced by small towers.

The mead hall is a fixture of Nord community life, acting as a place for feasting and partying, fighting and training, community gossip and mustering for war. Numerous fighters of all sorts of backgrounds meet here, hoping that in times of war, they can prove their heroism to their liege and to their people.
What the mead hall is to the great heroes of the Nords, the longhouse is to the average farmer. From these common hearths, great armies can be mustered.

A cosmopolitan Orc city is still an Orc city, some of whom are bound to be berserkers. These quarters consist of a basic barracks and training grounds so that these fearsome warriors can keep their skills sharp at all times.

Cities, especially Orc cities, tend to have little space for cavalry. This modest stable consists of an entire city's supply of horses, which are intended more for chasing down routing forces than engaging prepared ones.

A large settlement like a city means a large audience for combat sports, especially in a city populated by Orcs. Warriors from all over travel here to fight for prizes, and most will answer the call to arms so that they can prove themselves in a real battle.
A small parade ground where a unit of soldiers can march and practice military movements.
A medium sized parade ground where several units of soldiers can march and practice military movements.
A large parade ground allows the entire troops in a city to be able to march and practice military movements.
A parade ground of such a size not only allows the entirety of the city's soldiers, but also large forces from vassals or allies to march together.
Patrol posts around the city allow for an early warning of an incoming danger.
Patrol posts have now been replaced by wooden watchtowers which allow better observation of the surroundings.
Wooden watchtowers have been replaced by stone ones which are taller, more durable and allow for a quicker warning using fires or smoke signals.
A public school providing free education to anyone.
A public college, granting college level education to anyone.
A trade school where students are taught the basics of trade.
An economics college, where students can learn trade and finance.

Many Quey militia are skilled with the bow. They are lightly armoured, and benefit enormously from keeping a distance in combat. A group of archer militia are constantly training at this humble barracks.

Although simplistic, the war canoe is an extremely cost-effective and practical ship for the shallow waters of the Quey islands. This complex includes space for a shipwright, as well as docking for a large complement of war canoes.

Many Reachmen are self-taught in the ways of magic, learning from a combination of family traditions and personal training. These quarters are designed to house such locals, who help train fellow citizens to improve their magical techniques. These militia mages can also make useful soldiers in times of war.

Reachman cities can be extremely difficult to capture. In addition to the traditional fortifications, cheap but effective defensive structures are employed to delay attackers for as long as possible. This network of small, fortified redoubts make conquering the city an extremely unpleasant endeavor.

Many of the greatest swordfighters in all of Nirn are Redguard nobles, who train from a young age in the ways of swordsmanship. A group of local Redguard nobles live out of these quarters, constantly training for the inevitable call to war.

The sword is by far the most popular weapon in Redguard society, and even Redguard commoners often possess some sword training. This is a militia barracks for local sword-wielding fighters, whose skills are a useful addition to the levies.
This is the barracks where soldiers of the city's cavalry company are stationed.
This is an enlarged barracks where soldiers of the city's cavalry company are stationed
These are the quarters where the soldiers of the city's cavalry company are stationed.
This is where the horses of city's cavalry company are looked after.
This is where the horses of city's cavalry company are looked after.
A way station is a temporary lodging used in longer journeys and is also a service area for carriages.
Courier posts where travellers with urgent business can change their exhausted horses for new ones.
Couriers can switch out their mounts for fresh ones in order to deliver vital packages.
Dirt paths are unpaved roads made from the native material of the land surface. They are present throughout the land, especially in areas away from major settlements or highways.
Gravel roads are unpaved roads surfaced with gravel.
Cobblestone Roads are roads paved with cobblestones, stones that were rounded by the flow of water.

Highways are well built, well tended roads that connect major settlements to each other. Parts of highways that are away from major settlements, so are not frequently patrolled, are home to highwaymen", who collect money from travelers for "ensuring their safety" in their working area."

History tells that the Skyforge has existed since before the area was inhabited. According to the Songs of the Return, the local elves believed it to be a relic of the gods, and consequently gave the area a wide berth. The Companions, however, were quick to claim the Skyforge as their own once they discovered it, and they built their headquarters, Jorrvaskr, here. After this, others started settling, eventually forming what is now the city of Whiterun.

The Tang Mo are community-focused and zealous in their defenses against foreign invaders. This yard is a community training center, where any citizen can grab a simple weapon and learn the basics of combat. Although one-on-one they are no match for the most fearsome fighters, their bravery and numbers make them deadly en masse.

Many Tang Mo militia prefer to use slings instead of bows, since sling ammunition can be replenished in the most remote locations or with almost no supplies, and without the need of a fletcher or smith. Regardless, the sling is an effective weapon, and the slingers trained here are deadly opponents.
A temple dedicated to the Divines, or a Daedric prince, depending on local faith.
A hall of the dead is a funerary structure that contains the bodies of the dead. Halls of the dead are most commonly seen in Skyrim, where honoured dead are mummified to be preserved for eternity.
A temple in every quarter of the city will allow people to more easily meet their religious needs.
A small town hall where a town council can meet to decide on laws and issues.
A slightly larger town council hall has been built to accommodate the rising population.

column3: A town hall which is more than sufficient to administrate most towns.

column2: The city hall is now large enough that it is almost big enough to accommodate a true city.
The city is now big enough to be called a true city, meaning that a new hall has been built for a true city legislature.
The city has grown to match most others in the region, and has a medium sized legislature.
The city has grown into a large metropolis, and requires a large legislature to accommodate all of its citizens.
A whole complex has been built where legislatures and other government agencies are kept under one roof.
The city now has so many people that elected representatives are required for segments of the population, and dwell in this complex.
The mayor of this metropolis is such a prestigious position that whoever holds it lives in a palace fit for royalty.
The wealth and prestige of this city, along with the quality of its lodgings are such that those appointed as its mayor rule from a palace that even some royals envy.
A training area where guards and soldiers of the city are trained.
An extended training area where guards and soldiers of the city are trained.
A training barracks where recruits of guards and soldiers are stationed for the duration of their training.
Most undead troops fight as infantry, charging into battle with swords, axes, spears and bows. This is a large, subterranean burial complex which houses a variety of undead combatants.
Palisades may prevent bandits from attacking the town but won't even delay an enemy army.
Earth Walls may delay an enemy army for a short period of time, before they decide to scale the walls with ladders or blast the walls with fireballs.
A crude stonewall is the first step in the right direction in proper siege defence but won't stand long against siege engines.
Stone walls, built properly, will stand much more damage against siege engines and enemy mages and city's defenders, atop the walls, will be able to give the enemy scaling the walls a hard time.
Enchanted with magical runes, the city's walls now protects against attacks both material and magical. Even Daedric siege engines have little hope of doing damage to these walls!
A shipyard where ships, mostly of civilian nature, are built.
A wharf where boats are docked next to floating piers.
An entire complex of wharfs throughout the whole city.
An alchemy table in the patrician's palace where servants and family members can try their hand at making potions.
These quarters house the archers of the Patrician and his family.
A small office where an appointed individual or member of the family signs off on loans to small businesses and private individuals.
A small bank from whence the family may issue loans, bonds and writs to other merchants and private individuals, as well as hold the financial matters of individuals who entrust the family with them.
A large financial guild overseen by the family.
The dynasty's household guards are lodged within these simple quarters. They are crowded and unsanitary, but provide decent protection against the elements.
The dynasty's household guards are lodged within these quarters. They are crowded, but provide decent protection against the elements and some comforts for the men.
The dynasty's household guards are lodged within these spacious quarters. They provide decent protection against the elements and many comforts, making the soldiers feel right at home.

The dynasty's household guards are lodged within these barracks, a separate building entirely within the greater compound of the mansion or palace. It provides both protection and comfort for the men.
These large, spacious and extravagant barracks house the dynasty's guards in comfort, making them the envy of many a town guard.
Bee-keeping is a traditional past-time amongst patricians, and this family is no different.
A small room adjacent to the treasury where accountants keep records of the family's financial matters.
A room where the Patrician and his family may view small theatre productions.
A model of Nirn's solar system, where the Patrician may study the stars and planets.
An experienced word smith who writes letters and other correspondence for the patrician's family.
These dockmasters handle affairs at the docks for the patrician.
In this dojo the patrician and his family may learn hand to hand combat from powerful martial artists.
This dungeon is used to contain prisoners the patrician does not want the public to know where to find, or find out that they are kept there.
This addition to the library allows you to store all of your financial documents in an orderly fashion.

An entire wing of the library dedicated to collect all sort of books, letters and other writings on foreign lands and their customs. This greatly increases the family's ability to judge the worth of unknown goods and how to best acquire them.
A magical table where the patrician and his servants can magically enhance items using soul gems.
A servant who is an expert at making arrows for the patrician's soldiers.
A workshop where multiple household fletchers can create arrows.
A concealed room to fit the needs of the patrician, whether they be hiding his family, his riches, or more sinister items.
Any patrician or noble family has need of steeds, and the Stud Farm allows the family to pick only the finest stock for breeding which it can then utilise or trade off itself.
This simple but awesome mechanical device automatically transfers your handwriting into a ciphered form, so only the person with the exact copy of this machine can decipher it.
These Quarters house the Sworn Knights and Squires of the Household, men who have sworn their service to the family in exchange for gold, prestige and renown.
This room has been built for the patrician and his family to read various texts
A collection of rare, antique books dating to the time of the Reman Empire, up to the early Potentate.
A compound of a few ramshackle buildings surrounded by a low wall denotes the spartan but comfortable lodgings of your family and their servants.
A simple but impressive manor house in the local style.
A large, very impressive and prestigious manor house constructed to the local styles.
This mansion is impressive enough to command the respect of the surrounding countryside. It is clearly the home of someone important.
This mansion is impressive enough to command the respect of the surrounding countryside. It is clearly the home of someone important.
A palace fit for a Prince, its shining towers can be seen from a league away on a clear day. Though it may only consist of brick and mortar, it is the beating heart of this entire dynasty.

Truly, the splendour of this palace would be the envy of even an emperor. Its great halls shine of gold and marble, and hundreds of servants scurry through them daily in service of their masters. It is nothing less than a monument to the greatness of this dynasty.
This table displays maps of various types and of various locations for the patrician's benefit.
An extension to the Administrative Office, the Map Room offers a range of maps in differing styles and contexts for planning the dynasty's trade empire.
Here the patrician showcases weapons he has collected over the years.
A place where mead is created from the family's honey, produced from their beehives.
A smithy, where the patrician's personal blacksmith creates weapons.
The patrician has hired a master smith, renowned throughout the land, to make weaponry for him.
A few paintings and sculptures that the patrician has collected during his reign.
A larger art collection, where the artwork from across Tamriel can be found
This collection is the envy of all art lovers, filling the patrician with pride as nobles gasp at rare sculptures and paintings.
Quarters for the family's most trustworthy warriors.
The growing numbers of warriors loyal only to the employer's family require extra buildings to house them
What could make a warrior more loyal then a small house where he and his family can live in peace times.
The private moorings and docks belonging to the household, a place where new ships are laid and set-afloat, and were goods traded from across the world are unloaded.
The Family Altar is a small place of offering and prayer set into the entryway of the family quarters, and dedicated to the family's patron god or gods.
The Secluded Shrine is a private area where family members may sit, pray and give offerings to their gods.
The Family Chapel is a small church where family members and close friends attend private ceremonies and services from the household's own patron priest.
Here the horses of the patrician are stored, majestic mares and stallions bred over several generations.
A room where the Patrician oversees the affairs of his territory.
Here the accountants of the patrician oversee the patrician's assets.
Here the patrician is able to write and study finance.
Several apartment buildings constructed a short distance from the family palace, perfect for housing servants and their families with the added bonus of rent!

As the family has grown in wealth, so too has its land holdings. There's too much land for the family alone to tend, instead the land can be tended by Tenant Farmers who plant, tend and harvest crops or livestock. A portion of this stock is then sent to the Family.
A martial artist has taken residence here, and teaches local fighters and the patrician's family how to fight in hand-to-hand combat.
These instructors in martial arts are experienced in various fighting styles.
These instructors teach the patrician and his family better than any others, mainly because they have used hand to hand combat in actual war.
In these facilities the soldiers of the patrician can be trained in basic combat.
Here the soldiers of the patrician are trained in advanced techniques of warfare.
A private vault within which to store the family's wealth and prized treasures.
A very large, secure room for storing the family's wealth and treasures.
A personal vineyard adjacent to the mansion, perfect for evening strolls and making your own sweet wines.
A specialised cellar for the storing and maturation of fine wines from the family vineyard.
The Mage Quarters house the small cadre of mages that can be found in the employ of most families of wealthy means.
A desk where the patrician may write stories and letters.
Although forts are generally considered temporary delaying measures, constructing additional Kpylons! fortifications will allow us to further secure our frontiers against would-be attackers.
Upgrading our outpost into a keep by expanding our fortifications will allow us to staff more soldiers for the defense of the province and hold ground more effectively.

Our fort has grown from a small defensive outpost to a formidable bastion, with strong men staffing stronger walls. Any determined attacker, before seeking to lay waste to our precious lands, must first fight their way through our defenses.
Constructing dedicated living quarters for our garrison will allow us to staff more men for the defense of our fort.

Expanding the living quarters for our men will allow us to hire even more soldiers for the defense of the province, allowing them to send out more frequent patrols and serve as a deterrent to enemy raiding parties.
Akaviri Bow and Spear Training Field
Akaviri Bow and Spear Training Field

The bow and the spear are two weapons that are popular with Akaviri warriors, as they complement each other when used in tandem. This field is staffed by master archers and spearmen, who train the tribe's warriors in a variety of tactics and formations.
The Altmer boast incredible natural talent and many of them train specifically to be mages. This field provides the tribe's mages with a safe place to practice their spells.

Argonian warriors have a reputation for tenacity and a record for skillful utilization of guerrilla tactics. This camp provides fighters with training in a variety of weapons, and teaches them the best techniques for launching ambushes and hit-and-run strikes.
This is where quality weapons for the tribe's warriors are produced. Better equipment will help them fight much more effectively.

After the collapse of the last great Ayleid city-states of Cyrodiil during the First Era, the Ayleids gradually changed their military from one of heavily-armoured fighters to one comprised mostly of light troops. This camp is a place of lodging and training for a variety of Ayleid warriors..

Jaqspurs are Bosmer archers with remarkable marksmanship abilities. They are capable of picking off targets at incredible distances, but are deadly at any range. This complex includes a long-distance range for Jaqspurs to practice their skills.

Many Bretons are innately skilled in magic, and it is easy for a Breton ruler to find capable mages for their armies. This field allows local mages to practice their spells in a safe, closed-off space.
Cavalry is at the heart of a Colovian army's fighting capabilities. These stables provide a space for the outfitting and training of heavy cavalry warriors.

The traditional martial culture of the Velothi stresses four key elements. These are the bow, the sword, the spear and the spell. Warriors devoted to the latter two disciplines assemble and train here.

The spear is a supremely useful weapon for the Dwemer. A small square of spearmen can block a subterranean passageway against invaders, or cover mages and other warriors from the cavalry that their enemies often use. A squad of spearmen are trained, equipped and housed in these quarters.

Magic is a central part of Falmer martial culture, and mages are never in short supply. These grounds give the tribe's mages a safe place to practice their spells without damaging other buildings or injuring other tribespeople.
A master healer and some acolytes offer powerful healing spells and potions to their fellow tribespeople.
The local stronghold is home to the tribal government, and is fortified as the tribe's last line of defense should the vicinity fall under attack.
Hunters from all over the tribe meet here to form hunting parties, who can easily be called to fight in times of war.
Cyrodilic armies rely extensively on the use of infantry in order to achieve victory. Logistical expertise allows the tribe to cheaply recruit and train warriors at this war camp.

Most Kamal elite warriors prefer fighting on foot to fighting on cavalry, and are often highly skilled with spears, swords, axes and other weapons. This building provides housing for a group of fearsome, heavily-armoured troops.

Unlike the other races of Tamriel, the Khajiit do not use horses as war beasts. Instead the role of cavalry is fulfilled by four of quadrupedal Khajiit phases - the Pahmar, Pahmar-Raht, Senche, and Senche-Raht. All four types are trained and equipped at these grounds.
This drill yard provides a free space for mages to hone their craft without fear of inflicting collateral damage.

Snake Magic is an arcane talent of the Maormer, allowing them to train powerful serpents to serve as bodyguards and heavy mounts for their warriors. A small group of mages and their beasts are maintained at these grounds.
A market town provides a centralized trade node that will allow trade throughout our tribe to prosper.

A large number of Nibenese are skilled with magic, and it is easy to find and recruit such individuals for a tribe's fighting force. This field gives the tribe's mages a place to train without fear of damaging buildings or injuring tribespeople.

The daily life of a Nord adventurer is centered around the mead hall, a place to feast, get a drink, and boast of valorous deeds in the company of like-minded wanderers. Many of the fighters who congregate at this mead hall will happily fight on behalf of the tribe.
What the mead hall is to the great heroes of the Nords, the longhouse is to the average farmer. From these common hearths, great armies can be mustered.
The most feared Orc warriors are berserkers, who furiously charge into battle and fight to the death. This lodge is a place of meeting and training for the tribe's elite fighters.

Cavalry is not heavily favoured by Orc warriors, but is still useful for screening enemy horsemen, charging weak points in enemy lines, and running down fleeing foes. The tribe's war horses are kept in these stables.

A large number of Po Tun are naturally gifted in the arcane arts, and many choose to use magick as their primary weapon in combat. These grounds are set apart from the other buildings so that the mages can hone their skills without causing any collateral damage.
The tribe's best archers confer here in their spare time to sharpen their skills and engage in contests of marksmanship.

War canoes are quick and cheap to produce, and very useful for navigating the shallow waters of the Quey islands. These docks provide the tribe with a place to dock their canoes, as well as a small camp where lightly-armoured raiders congregate.

Reachman settlements are traditionally well-fortified to protect against foreign invaders or even other bands of Reachmen. This system of redoubts, lined with sharpened stakes, provides additional space for the tribe's warriors and helps to slow down enemy sieges.

Redguards are renowned horsemen, masterfully using fast-moving, lightly-armored horses to outmaneuver their foes on the battlefield. These stables provide a place for local warriors to train and outfit their steeds.
A shipwright is hard at work building seafaring vessels for our tribe.
This ornately-decorated shrine is constantly filled with tribespeople who stop in to worship, seek blessings and gain spiritual guidance.
These stables provide housing and food for our mounted warriors' beasts of burden.
Slings are popular among the Tang Mo due to their simplicity and the abundance of ammunition, regardless of supply lines. This range grants the tribe's slingers a space to train for battle.
This simple drill yard is run by several veteran warriors who provide instruction to aspiring fighters in the ways of war, increasing the number of combat-ready troops.

The Dai-Katana is a terrifying weapon, but requires careful training to be wielded effectively. This field is run by the tribe's greatest Dai-Katana warriors, who train fellow tribespeople in proper sword techniques.

On the surface, this crypt appears to be little more than a simple tomb, but is in fact a sprawling complex filled with coffins and a catacomb network. When the restless dead are not summoned to fight, they reside here.
A tiny village is located near the tribe's fortifications. If we are besieged, a few villagers can aid in the defense.
A small village is located near the tribe's fortifications. If we are besieged, some villagers can aid in the defense.
A modest village is located near the tribe's fortifications. If we are besieged, many villagers can aid in the defense.
A large village is located near the tribe's fortifications. If we are besieged, a veritable army of villagers can aid in the defense.
This camp is home to a small fighting force of warriors who constantly train for battle. They are always eager to fight enemy armies and raid hostile settlements.
This tower is devoted to the training and housing of alteration mages.
Armor spells, levitation, and other useful arts of alteration are taught here by a master mage.

A spire permanently suspended in the air as a show of the local masters' prowess with levitation and other arts of alteration. Aspiring students are trained with the expectation that they too will be able to perform such feats.

The finest and most experienced Altmer mages travel far and wide to this stately edifice as a place of lodging, study, debate, and combat training. These facilities are of exceptional quality and craftsmanship and are intended to provide the finest accommodations for those most adept in the arcane arts.

The crowning organizational achievement of an Altmer settlement is the cultivation of an army of powerhouse war mages. These barracks house such individuals, who spend decades or even centuries immersed in physical conditioning and magical study to form elite forces that are capable of totally annihilating enemy armies with beguiling Illusions, fearsome Daedra and devastating Destruction spells.
The main center of learning of the Mages Guild in Cyrodiil. To gain entrance, one must receive a recommendation from all guild halls in Cyrodiil.
The archers trained here can split an arrow on a bullseye, and incapacitate enemies with arrows to the knee.
A few targets where archers can hone their skills.
A larger range where many archers can hone their shooting at once.
The armoury of your temple is where arms and armour are stored when they are not in use.
An extended armoury that can store more arms and armour.
These temple windows are constructed with beautiful leaded glass.
These ornaments are made by master glass workers.
Master sculptors create these magnificent statues.
Stone cutters carve majestic religious altars that are seen as beautiful even to non-believers.

The spectacular magical talents of the Ayleids manifests in expertly-trained arcane combatants such as these Arch-Mages. Skilled in all of the schools of magic, they can devastate hostile forces and unleash beneficial spells to instill bravery and strength into any fighting force.
Hall of Meteoric Glass and Iron
Hall of Meteoric Glass and Iron
Hall of Meteoric Glass and Iron

Meteoric glass and iron possess incredible magical abilities, and are the materials used for feats of arcane engineering such as Welkynd stones and Ayleid wells. This hall is dedicated to the study and application of these Aetherial fragments for military purposes. The elite enchanters and sorcerers who work with these materials are exceptional fighters and are always pleased to lend their skills against their enemies.
A small bathhouse where citizens can enjoy the benefits of basic hygiene.
A large scale bathhouse, where dozens of citizens can come together in massive pools heated by magical and natural means.
A massive thermae complex, hundreds of citizens bathe and swim.
Quarters where the academy battlemages reside.
A small boarding school where students living far from the temple would live for the duration of their education.
A quarters given to the exchange students coming from other cities and towns.
A  boarding school where students living far from the temple would live during their education.

Breton mages are amongst the finest in all of Tamriel, their arcane talents can accomplish a wide range of military goals and they are sometimes regarded as the greatest war mages on the continent. This hall is dedicated to the study of magick and the training of elite mages in the ways of war.

Knowing how to use martial magick and knowing how to use magick for martial purposes are two entirely different concepts, and mastering the latter is a specialty of the Bretons. Here, Breton mages with unique abilities are housed and equipped so that they can provide their knowledge and their prodigious abilities for fame, fortune, and the chance of proving themselves worthy of nobility.
A large tower where major and minor conjuration rituals can be performed.
Advanced forms of summoning are practiced in this hall, which is overseen by a master conjurer.
A handful of master conjurers have taken up residence here, teaching aspiring conjuration mages in the powerful arts of summoning and mind-control.
An accomplished artisan and an apprentice design these complex weapons in this workshop.
Multiple artisans design crossbows in this workshop.
An assembly line, staffed by numerous artisans, allows for the rapid production of crossbows for local troops.
Here artists work sculpting and painting in the hopes of selling their work to patrons.
In this theatre, productions made by local artists are showcased.
In this square, arguing parties may debate in front of the people over economic, cultural, religious and political issues, among others.

An orrery is a scaled model of a solar system that depicts planetary motion. A team of scholars work tirelessly to take readings from the planetary models and harness the mystical powers associated with them.
In this facility anyone who wishes may be taught the fine arts.
A law faculty raising judges and lawyers.
Here students are taught the history of Nirn.
A tower where students of magick are taught the basic spells of destruction.
An academy where destruction mages are taught how to use offensive magick and apply it in combat.
A team of master mages oversee large numbers of students, providing them with the insight to master fire, frost and lightning.

Traditional Velothi magical conventions favour destruction and conjuration (sans necromancy). This complex houses a collection of arcane combatants specializing in destruction magic, Daedra-summoning, mind-control, and other devastating arts that can flatten enemy forces into dust finer than the ash of Vvardenfell.

The Dunmer are among the most magically-gifted races in Tamriel and many individuals are renowned for their superb arcane capabilities. Warm beds, private labs and top-of-the-line training facilities afforded by this structure attract a steady supply of talented mages who serve the local liege.

The Tonal Architects are the elite mage-engineers of Dwemer society. This school trains individuals in designing and crafting technologies to benefit the advancement of their people. However, the instructors are themselves Tonal Architects, and possess terrifying arcane capabilities that can completely destroy enemy armies.

Although they are not traditionally seen on the battlefield, Tonal Architects wield incredibly powerful magicks that can have a decisive effect on the battlefield. These quarters function as a place for study and engineering, and as a training ground for perfecting arcane combat techniques.
A mathematical faculty where advanced mathematics is taught.
Here students are taught architectural and mechanical courses.
Aspiring archaeologists come to this facility to learn their craft.
Here scale models of buildings can be constructed before being fully built.
These sites allow farmers to sow and harvest land without interfering with any other citizens.
In this workshop many inventions and designs are made.
This local dig site searches for any nearby ruins from earlier cultures.

Falmer mages are among the more powerful spellcasters known to exist. Much of their accumulated arcane knowledge can be used in battle, and to great effect. This tower is a place of study and training for some of the most skilled and experienced Falmer Arch-Mages.

Magic factors heavily into Falmer warfare as a result of their natural magical abilities and their near-immunity to frost. Falmer mages can unleash powerful frost spells with little fear of collateral damage, but are indeed capable in a variety of other forms of magic, including employing the other elements in Destruction. These quarters are dedicated to housing, training, and equipping Falmer wizards for battle.
This relatively small farm provides crops specifically for the settlement, feeding locals and filling the local market.
More akin to a plantation than a family farm, this complex produces large quantities of crops for locals and for export.
This small gate house lets guards decide who comes in and out of the settlement.
These gates are magically charged to protect the settlement in the case of an attack
A small barracks where temple guards live.
A medium-sized barracks where temple guards live.
A large barracks where temple guards live.
This small garden grows herbs like Nirnroot to be used in healing.
A large field where many herbs are grown at once.
A massive herb plantation where alchemical ingredients are grown for domestic use and export abroad.
This is where those with common illnesses are healed.
This hospital is fully-staffed by respected healers and treats a wide array of illnesses and injuries.
Anyone deemed mentally unstable is kept here, and some patients have been seen walking off with a white haired man talking about cheese
The hospital has been upgraded and his now fully staffed by healers.
This room is for performing internal medical procedures that magick alone cannot accomplish.
This hospital is now so large that it can service an entire duchy on its own.
All the mentally unstable of the settlement are sent to this cordoned-off center for dwelling and treatment.

A medical training center housing a host of healers, surgeons, apothecaries to cure the sick, and tend to the wounded. A quarantine area serves to separate the ones with serious illnesses or plagues from the rest of the patients to minimize the risks of epidemics.
Pilgrim shacks at the disposal of pilgrims visiting the temple.
A boarding house where rooms are rented to pilgrims.
A hostel for those on a pilgrimage.
This tower has been built for any who wish to practice illusion spells.
The illusion tower has been expanded and now features quarters for a master instructor to teach the arts of illusion.
Those in this hall learn to study illusions often associated with dreams, and apply the complex sorts of spells that could put whole armies to sleep!

Many Imperial mages train to become battlemages, fighting for their liege, for profit, personal glory, or any combination of the three. These quarters house a small group of elite battlemages, whose mighty powers can control the flow of a battle.

Battlemages can have a decisive impact on the battlefield, but need space if they are to train without inflicting collateral damage. These grounds feature open spaces, practice ranges, and dueling rings where aspiring battlemages hone their skills.

Unlike the other peoples of Tamriel, the Khajiit do not use horses or other beasts for their cavalry. Instead, they rely on four of their quadrupedal phases - the Pahmar, Pahmar-Raht, Senche and Senche-Raht. This barracks offers living quarters for light and heavy "cavalry" alike.
A library having a small collection of the most common and cheapest books.
This medium-sized library is well-staffed and well-maintained, and features a respectable collection of common and uncommon texts alike.
This large library holds hundreds of tomes and books, some rare, some common.
A Library of a magnificent size, housing everything from rousing epics and bawdy plays, to rare tomes and unprecedented first editions.
This special academy trains mages in the seven schools of magic.
Here mages are taught by instructors who focus more on fast training than good training. Watch out for flying ice spikes!
A simple training course, staffed with skilled and experienced instructors.
A much better course for battlemage with experienced instructors who can teach complex spells to the trainees and provide a myriad of obstacles.
Here, master mages teach their students with the utmost expertise. Soldiers who emerge from this course unscathed are already effectively battle-tested.
These runes will warn the people if an enemy force is attacking
These traps will slightly delay attackers by setting off destruction spells if soldiers get too close.
These wards strengthen local fortifications against a variety of attacks, both physical and magical.
This shroud will temporarily hide citizens from any attacking soldiers.
These pedestals spouting ice or fire slow down attackers, who must disable them from a long distance.
These defences confuse attackers, making them see things that don't exist.
These wards utilize reflective magicks to turn attacks back at those who wield them. A hostile army can be devasted by its own spells, making sieges even more difficult.
In the workshop, basic alchemical recipes are concocted.
This workshop is where weapons and armour are enchanted with magical rituals.
Here mages and mystics attempt to predict the future, although they are not always precise.
At this library even the lowest of society can rent books, as long as the promise to return them.
At this workshop various texts are transcribed to scrolls to be saved for future generations.
The palace of the Mane of Elsweyr, where he commands over his subjects.

The snake magick that the Maormer practice allows them to charm and train vicious serpents into loyal guardians, beasts of burdens and mounts for their elite warriors. Here, a group of snake mages ply their craft to provide battle-ready serpents. These mages are also capable fighters and can assist in battle.
At this facility, various military strategies are studied.
Here, medicine and healing are studied.
The properties of metals and how to forge them are studied at this facility.
At this small arena, champions fight for gold and glory.
At this range, advanced ranged weapons such as arbalests can be test fired before being used in battle
Cadavers of fallen soldiers are brought into this morgue for medical professionals to study, offering life-saving insight on the causes and preventions of major injuries.
The smith here is constantly attempting to make new technologies beyond just swords and bows.

A militia is a fighting force that is composed of non-professional fighters. Temples generally rely on militia, rather than soldiers, to defend them. This building is a small barracks reserved for temple's militia.

A militia is a fighting force that is composed of non-professional fighters. Temples generally rely on militia, rather than soldiers, to defend them. This building is a medium barracks reserved for temple's militia.

A militia is a fighting force that is composed of non-professional fighters. Temples generally rely on militia, rather than soldiers, to defend them. This building is a large barracks reserved for temple's militia
At this barracks, fighters from different backgrounds are mixed together.
A much larger mixed barracks, where various different fighters bunk together.
In this mixed training ground, all types of soldiers train side by side.
A much larger field where soldiers can not only hone their own craft but receive training in advanced mixed-unit tactics.
A small museum of local history.
A collection of reliquaries and other minor religious items are on display, attracting tourists and pilgrims alike.
This adjoining facility features a variety of fascinating antiquities and is staffed by historians, archaeologists, adventurers and other knowledgeable individuals.
Contemporary paintings, sculptures and other works of art for art's sake are displayed here.
A menagerie of peculiar relics and artifacts are showcased here. Many are claimed to be exceptionally rare and valuable, and are kept under the tightest lock and key.
In this tower mages are taught mysticism magic.
Here students are taught how to enchant weapons and armour, bind souls, and detect people, animals and objects.
The masters who study and teach at this tower possess an incredible grasp of the mystical arts, and pass their skills on to bevies of apprentices.

The battlemage is the backbone of the average Nibenese army, and training quality battlemages is of the utmost importance to this end. These training facilities are lavishly constructed and well-staffed, helping promising mages transform into the powerhouse combatants who lead Nibenese armies to victory.

Nibenay is the home of the battlemage, where warriors with magical abilities are the greatest of the local military elites. These quarters act as a place of residence and study for outstanding mages who are always ready to fight.
Although primarily used for festivals, this parade ground also provides a useful space for troops to train.
The upgraded parade ground can now host larger festivals or alternately, provide a large space for troops to hone their skills.
These quarters house pikemen, experts at sticking it with the pointy end.
Po Tun Hall of the Arcane

The Po Tun have a natural affinity for magick that makes many of their mages especially powerful. The strongest mages are maintained in these spacious quarters to study the magical arts and lend their powers to allied armies during times of war.
Powerful mages give the armies of the Po Tun a distinct edge on the battlefield. These quarters house a small but mighty group of elite mages whose devastating abilities are the bane of enemy forces.

Although simplistic, the war canoe is an extremely cost-effective and practical ship for the shallow waters of the Quey islands. This complex includes space for a shipwright, as well as docking for a large complement of war canoes.

Among the Reachmen, mages are often self-taught or educated in small villages by local shamans, but they are naturally talented and their techniques are more than sound. Veteran mages who are well-versed in the Reachmen's ancient battle-magicks organize at this hall to codify their knowledge and train for war.

The Reachmen have a tradition of fortifying everything that they can, including their academies and temples. These redoubts are equipped with walls of blinds, vicious sharpened stakes, and deadly traps to dissuade would-be attackers from setting foot in this settlement.

Mages are some of the mightiest fighters among the Reachmen. Typically favouring frost spells but highly capable in other forms of Destruction as well as Conjuration and Restoration, they can utterly ravage enemy battle lines and heal allies to turn the tide at a moment's notice. These quarters house a small band of spectacularly-powerful mages.

Redguards venerate the sword as the greatest of all weapons. There are some whose veneration is extremely zealous, and who train day and night in pursuit of perfect skill with the blade. This hall maintains a small set of these elite fighters, whose incredible skills and unshakable valor inspire fellow troops in even the most desperate battles.
This tower is used to train mages in the healing art of restoration magic.
A master restoration mage is now on staff at the tower, providing excellent training to aspiring healers.
The team of master restoration mages at this tower boast an incredible understanding of restoration spells that can help even the most hopeless neophyte become a respectable healer.
This small workshop makes basic spears for local militia troops.
This medium workshop includes a complete production line to keep local forces properly outfitted.
This huge workshop produces a bevy of spears and polearms, and is capable of keeping a small army well-supplied.
A small gymnasium used for sports and training.
Race tracks for horses and humans.
A gymnasium used for sports and training.
A throwing range where javelins, disks, darts, and axes are thrown, both for sports and as a part of military training.
A huge stadium combining the race tracks, gymnasium and throwing ranges in one large area.
Basic magical staves are made at this small workshop.
This dedicated workshop is home to an Expert enchanter, capable of making a variety of powerful staves.
A master enchanter has taken up residence here, and oversees a team of journeymen and apprentices to produce large quantities of high-quality staves.

Although by no means the largest temple in all of Tamriel, the Temple of the One is undoubtedly the most important. The Dragonfires possess far more than a ceremonial importance, and seal the barriers between Mundus and Oblivion to protect against large-scale Daedric invasions.
This chapel allows a small group of worshippers to meet.
This small temple allows a larger group of believers to worship.
A medium sized temple for a sizeable group of worshippers.
A large temple which accommodates an expansive number of worshippers.
This temple has grown enough in size that it maintains several ancillary buildings.
This complex is a settlement unto itself, and the central temple is large enough to be seen from miles away.
A school where mages are given basic training to perform the schools of magic.

A tower dedicated to the teaching of magical school of thaumaturgy. Thaumaturgy deals with the temporary manipulation of laws and forces, unlike alteration spells thaumaturgical spells don't change the appearance or structure of a force or object.
A golem workshop is where golems, or atronachs as they are more commonly called, are created and studied.
These chambers practice the strange art of teleportation, sending one's body up to hundreds of miles away through the use of magic
This is where the militia of the temple are given basic training on use of arms and armour and also some tactics.
Training grounds where extended training, like operating of siege engines, is given to the militia.

The Tsaesci are somewhat adept in the arcane arts, and their finest mages confer with one another, always intent on increasing their comprehension of magic. Although this hall exists mainly for magical study, the spellcasters maintained here are extremely capable in combat.

Many Tsaesci mages train for hundreds of years in the ways of combat magic, and this time combined with their natural abilities results in some attaining incredible levels of power. This hall is devoted to the housing of such exceptional individuals, and includes testing and training facilities so that they may better hone their skills for combat.

Undead warriors are fearless foes that can utilize all sorts of weapons, and which generally fight on foot. When they are not called to battle, many of them reside in this large, underground burial complex.
This center of higher education primarily teaches religious subjects, but also educates students on fundamentals such as language and writing.
Matters of religion and magick are taught in tandem at this university, attracting a broad array of scholars and refining their skills with precision and efficiency.
High walls built around the outskirts of the settlement.
These walls have been reinforced by local alteration mages to withstand incredible amounts of damage from hostile spells and siege weapons.

Barracks serve as the home for the standing army of a trade-post, the men and women who have stepped up for promise of coin to serve the local Merchant Guild in the protection of its alleged sovereignty.

Just outside the trade post's walls is a small plot of land dedicated to the cultivation of the unique sugarcane that yields valuable moon sugar.
The trade post is surrounded by fields of tall sugarcane, carefully tended and harvested to provide a steady supply of sweet moon sugar.

column2: This section of the trade post deals in restricted substances of a narcotic nature.
Due to slavery being legal within this province, a small encampment of slavers has set up within the trade post's walls, buying and selling a small number of captives.
This trade post is home to a large market dedicated to the sale of captive persons.
Nearly a settlement in its own right, this sprawling facility is the epicenter of the province's slave trade.
A series of hidden cellars beneath the main trade post provides a way to covertly increase profits on shipping goods.
A shack near the trade post where off-duty workers gather to have a few drinks.
A freestanding establishment providing patrons with food and beverages to ease the stress of their travels.
In addition to a bar and dining area, this building maintains a handful of rooms to offer patrons a place to spend the night.

The cost of maintaining the major highways and roads that allow trade to flow along the major routes can be an expensive undertaking. Toll Houses allow the controller of a section of the route to more effectively place charges upon caravans and travellers for their use of the route, helping with the costs of maintaining the roads.

Almalexia's Temple is the single most important building in the entire Mournhold region, and acts as the Lady of Mercy's place of residence as well as a house of worship for the Almsivi faithful. Many of the elite warriors and mages who comprise Almalexia's Hands are maintained on-site.

Ominous towers, impermeable walls, a fortified gate and an intricate network of internal defenses protect what is one of Tamriel's most formidable castles. Every bridge, courtyard, stairwell and corridor is patrolled by bands of skeletal undead, and watched by vigilant gargoyles.

The Great Chapel of Arkay is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of life, death and the seasons. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Akatosh is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of time and chief of the Divines. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Dibella is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of beauty and sexuality. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Julianos is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of wisdom and magic. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Kynareth is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of the wind and the elements. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Mara is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of love and compassion. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Stendarr is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of mercy and justice. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Talos is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of mankind and war. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

The Great Chapel of Zenithar is the world's foremost structure devoted to the Divine of work and commerce. This exquisite temple features a central altar and small ancillary altars for each Divine, and maintains a group of priests and healers.

This grand structure is the home of Vivec, the Warrior-Poet of the Almsivi. Although the compound's underlying Puzzle Canal is open to anyone, Vivec's personal abode is notoriously secure. Impregnable walls and doors, as well as patrols of Buoyant Armigers, Ordinators and summoned Daedra, protect the site from unwelcome visitors.
Local resources and manpower were utilized to unearth and develop the ruins found in this province. It will be some time until further work can occur.

Massive stone arches, some dotted with animal motifs, jut from the earth. Bearded faces made of stone silently guard the half-buried doors to this enigmatic site. Bandits frequently camp here, and are easy prey for local adventurers who reintroduce their quarries' ill-gotten gains back into the local economy.

Government-funded excavations are ongoing at these ruins. The current projects are simple and do not extend far past the main entrance, but regularly uncover old tools, pottery and other antiquities of value.
By hiring guards to protect the diggers, the local excavation team has been able to push past roving Draugr and dangerous booby-traps and bring home many valuable items.
Significant amounts of money have been spent to fund the excavations here, but the main burial vaults of elite warriors and their lords have been cracked. Spectacular riches are being hauled out.
These catacombs are rife with shambling Draugr, but every single undead carries weapons, armour and other valuables that can be brought back as treasure.
Uncovering this sculpture and deciphering its curious runic text offers a great deal of insight about the purpose of the old compound and its inhabitants.

Further excavations have located an armoury filled with old weapons and shields. Those items which are in too poor of condition to give to our troops can always be melted down to produce steel and iron ingots.
Secret passages have been discovered within the ruins' deeper reaches. Shiny stacks of gold coins and finely-crafted jewellery are regularly being recovered.

Moss and vines cover the remains of a stately Ayleid palace-citadel. Local treasure hunters sometimes discover errant coffers with small hoards of gold, but little else. The stone double-doors of the site are unlocked but remain closed, for fear of agitating the numerous undead which lurk within.

Thanks to dedicated funding, scholars and archaeologists are making forays into the ruins, aided by armed escorts who hold back the undead that once stalked the antechambers. Stashes of riches, including powerful Welkynd stones, are finally being recovered.

New chambers are being opened up as the undead guardians of the ruins are gradually defeated, one-by-one. Intrepid teams are dismantling traps and marking pressure plates while others uncover additional Welkynd stones, hand-crafted jewellery and beautiful sculptures and frescoes.

Excavation teams have managed to reach the ruins' central throne room and adjacent vaults. Exquisite grave goods, coffers full of gold, welkynd and varla stones are among the riches being brought back to the surface, while study of more artistic subjects has opened up.
Varla Stones are spectacular items but are often perplexing to loose from their protective cages. Concentrated funding allows for better-coordinated efforts in acquiring these artifacts.

Much of the art found in this ancient complex is in poor condition but offers critical clues about First Era Ayleid culture when pieced together. Artisans and scholars are making the most of this treasure trove of knowledge.
