Most locals stay far away from the intricately-carved stone towers and steles of this abandoned shrine, and for good reason. Ravenous Daedra stalk the vicinity. Sometimes, adventurers hunt the Daedra down and bring home items looted from their corpses as prizes.
Bounties for the elimination of the Daedra wandering the outside of these ruins has finally made the area safe, in addition to returning substantial amount of alchemical ingredients and weaponry.

The inhabitants of this complex offer serious resistance, but concentrated funding has encouraged local treasure hunters to band together and push the Daedra further into the shrine's recesses, recovering various valuables along the way. Some mages have been able to enthral a handful of Dremora spellcasters, who now utilize their arcane capabilities to tend to the wounded and sick.

Larger armed parties have finally managed to push into the central shrine, defeating the Daedric guardians and returning piles of jewels, scrolls and pristine weapons. A team of conjurers have been able to convince" a few of the higher-ranking Dremora within the complex to teach local military officers in the ways of Daedric military strategies and tactics."

Many Dremora are skilled spell-casters, and their talents frequently include the College of Restoration. For a price, Conjurers and other mages can enthral these Dremora and use their healing abilities to help the province's population.

Many Dremora are skilled spell-casters, and their talents frequently include the College of Restoration. For a price, Conjurers and other mages can enthral these Dremora and use their healing abilities to help the province's population.

A few Dremora from the higher-ranking castes dwell in this shrine. Although generally hostile, they can be calmed and reasoned with thanks to the efforts of mages trained in Conjuration and Illusion. These Dremora possess excellent knowledge of military tactics and strategy, which they can be convinced to pass along to local scholars and military officers.

A few Dremora from the higher-ranking castes dwell in this shrine. Although generally hostile, they can be calmed and reasoned with thanks to the efforts of mages trained in Conjuration and Illusion. These Dremora possess excellent knowledge of military tactics and strategy, which they can be convinced to pass along to local scholars and military officers.

Although seemingly abandoned for thousands of years, these ruins are still very much alive. Clouds of steam billow out from the pipes and vents of the enormous geometric towers. Although no one has ever seriously explored the site's interior, its surrounding area frequently yields samples of valuable scrap metal.

Providing funding for a basic expedition has permitted scholars to begin studying the advanced technologies that reside within. Teams of guards are keeping the complex's automated defenders in check and a defunct observatory, brimming with astronomical and metaphysical documents, has been unearthed.

As explorers push further into the ruins, the ruins' animonculory is reached and resistance from the automatons becomes more intense. Thankfully, the well-equipped expeditionary team has been able to destroy and loot most of them, recovering soul gems and mechanical parts in the process. Studies of the facility itself offer useful insights regarding ancient Dwemer manufacturing processes.

Excavators have finally reached the debate hall and an adjacent weapons smithy. In addition to defeating and scrapping Dwemer contraptions, the teams are uncovering priceless antiquities that provide vital clues about the Dwemer's achievements, especially those related to weapons and armor engineering.
This chamber offers very little in the way of tangible treasure, but contains devices and tomes which, if decoded, can shed some light on fields on astronomical and metaphysical research.

The expedition has discovered a way into the ruins' Animonculory, where curious Dwemer automatons are produced. Intensive study of the facilities and its output is sure to offer some knowledge about Dwemer technologies and manufacturing techniques.

Although the exact materials used in Dwemer weapons production are unknown, the craftsmanship itself is worth serious study. Uncovering and researching this old forge and the processes used to make arms and armour can greatly benefit our own smiths' knowledge.

The exact purpose of this series of storage rooms is unknown, but it contains vast riches. Defeating its guardians and unlocking the gates and chests located within provides an excellent source of gold, jewellery and enchanted treasures.

Legends tell of an ancient city that once stood in this area, but there is little proof of that aside from stone pillars and tiled roofs sticking out of the ground. Anything else is buried under meters of solid earth. The site's seclusion makes it a popular meeting destination for bandits, in turn attracting adventurers who hunt them down and sell their belongings off in nearby villages.

A government-sponsored excavation team is undertaking projects at this location. They have barely scratched the surface, but are finding relatively intact structures buried underneath, along with various ancient goods such as old coins, pottery and tools.

A larger team of excavators has been able to move immense amounts of sand and soil out of the way, clearing entrances to what appear to be residential and commercial buildings, along with an old library filled with dusty but largely-intact tomes containing ancient knowledge.

The expedition is now working on what appears to be a palace compound, ostensibly the home of some long-forgotten ruler. Chests containing gold, jewellery, and even sealed jugs of wine are being brought back to the surface.

Uncovering the entrance to this old storeroom offers a substantial quantity of ancient steel weapons. Many are in good condition, and those which are not good enough quality to issue to local troops can be sold off at the markets.

Uncovering the entrance to this old storeroom offers a substantial quantity of ancient steel weapons. Many are in good condition, and those which are not good enough quality to issue to local troops can be sold off at the markets.

One of the more fascinating buildings in this archaic settlement is what appears to be an old library. Many books and scrolls here are in pristine condition. With proper funding, they should prove relatively easy for local scholars to decipher and can provide all sorts of useful information.

Thousands of years ago, Human Akaviri dominated the eastern continent, building trade posts and fortresses wherever they went. This dilapidated castle has been abandoned for thousands of years, but hardy adventurers sometimes make forays into its booby-trapped halls and return with handfuls of treasure and stories of zealous spectral guardians.

Acting on information given by the locals, the government has paid for a well-armed expedition to scour these ruins for treasure. The castle's undead guardians are proving tenacious and only the first few chambers of the compound have been secured. Still, ancient valuables are being recovered.

Improved funding has allowed for a better-equipped team to push further into the castle's recesses. As more undead are eliminated, rooms containing sculptures, coins and gemstones are being discovered and looted.

The team has finally reached the inner sanctum of the castle and dispatched the ghosts of the long-dead Akaviri who stood guard over it. Innumerable treasures are being uncovered and brought back from the premises, such as jewellery and finely-balanced swords that can be used to improve the quality of the local fighting force.

Armor and especially weapons produced in the traditional Akaviri style are known all over Nirn for their incredible strength and durability. The weapons and armour found in this old vault are extremely old but are worth studying to better understand the exquisite smithing techniques they were made with.

The weapons and armour found in this old vault are extremely old but are worth studying to better understand the exquisite smithing techniques they were made with.

An excavation team has opened the seals protecting this long-forgotten crypt. Although fiercely defended by ghostly protectors, the coffins located within contain an astounding collection of valuable grave goods.

An excavation team has opened the seals protecting this long-forgotten crypt. Although fiercely defended by ghostly protectors, the coffins located within contain an astounding collection of valuable grave goods.

Perfectly-rounded masonry spires poke through the earth, indicating the millennia-old handiwork of the ancient Aldmeri. Whatever secrets these structures hold are hidden by a blanket of soil and vegetation. Shrewd treasure hunters sometimes unearth stray valuables which fetch high prices from collectors.

An archaeological team has been sponsored to dig here, and is already starting to uncover long-forgotten relics buried in the soil surrounding the buildings. Further work will be required to access the structures, however.

Increased funding is allowing the excavators to perform more work and do so more delicately. Some buildings have been entirely unearthed. Fragile jewellery and pottery are among the items being recovered.

The team has reached a central estate which they believe was the residence of the locality's Canonreeve. Plates, vases, sculptures and other priceless antiquities have been extracted from the ancient manor's stonework halls and chambers.

Much like their modern Altmer descendants, the ancient Aldmer were deeply enthralled by the visual and performing arts. Many old works of art, some completed and some half-completed, can be restored and studied to glean cultural information.

Much like their modern Altmer descendants, the ancient Aldmer were deeply enthralled by the visual and performing arts. Many old works of art, some completed and some half-completed, can be restored and studied to glean cultural information.

This old building appears to have once been a place of residence and study for at least a few practitioners of the arcane arts. Enchanted weapons, armour and other items are being uncovered and researched to acquire knowledge of the magickal techniques once used by this site's inhabitants.

This old building appears to have once been a place of residence and study for at least a few practitioners of the arcane arts. Enchanted weapons, armour and other items are being uncovered and researched to acquire knowledge of the magickal techniques once used by this site's inhabitants.

Broken stone pillars and arches greet anyone bold enough to set foot on this half-buried, monolithic complex. It is a popular haunt for bandit gangs and necromancer covens, whose corpses are often looted by parties of adventurers.

An excavation team has been contracted to begin moving the sand dunes which hide the site's entrances. Along the way, they have recovered loose coins and pottery, as well as rusted weapons and armour from untold ancient battles.

Further funding has allowed the excavators to find a way into the old complex and begin unearthing chests of gold, as well as myriad antiquities. Those items which are durable enough to endure the crushing weight of the sands are remarkably well-preserved.

Archaeologists at the site are certain that the team has reached a throne room, the walls of which are covered in ornamental swords and shields, likely worth a lot of coin. In addition, the workmanship of this inner chamber is an exquisite example of modular Yokudan stonemasonry, and should help local architects improve the quality of their structures.

A stockpile of exceptional Yokudan swords has been discovered. These steel blades are superbly-balanced and most are still sharp the touch. Spending on their recovery and repair will provide local garrisons with many additional weapons.

A stockpile of exceptional Yokudan swords has been discovered. These steel blades are superbly-balanced and most are still sharp the touch. Spending on their recovery and repair will provide local garrisons with many additional weapons.

Yokudan architecture, as reflected in the techniques used by the modern Redguards, is famous for durability and a modular design which allows damaged structural components to be swapped out for new ones with minimal difficulty. Devoting additional resources to studying examples of this style will provide a bounty of architectural knowledge.

Ancient carved steles, rock-hewn shrines, and towering xanmeers are slowly sinking into the murky waters of the Argonian swamplands. Occasionally, locals or foreign treasure hunters stumble upon mud-covered weaponry and other implements, which they sell off at nearby markets.

Archaeologists and engineers hired to work at this site are working together to divert water away from the stone structures and dig nearby in hopes of recovering stray valuables. Currently, the effort is paying off, with small caches of old coins and treasure being recovered.

Better funding has permitted the team working around the ruins to unearth entire buildings, including the complex's central xanmeer. It is rich with coins, jewellery and ornamental weaponry, all of which are steadily being hauled out.

The excavators have uncovered the remains of an ancient marketplace, packed with baskets, chests, vases and other vessels. Coins, jewels, rare alchemical ingredients and even ancient scrolls are among the valuables being acquired from these surprisingly well-preserved containers.

Local masons are hard at work repairing the structural elements of the towering xanmeer, while sculptors are carefully beautifying the weathered relief carvings that depict the Argonians who lived here hundreds of years ago.

Local masons are hard at work repairing the structural elements of the towering xanmeer, while sculptors are carefully beautifying the weathered relief carvings that depict the Argonians who lived here hundreds of years ago.

Members of the excavation team have located a submerged vault, filled with loot such as enchanted apparel and coins made of precious metals. Focusing resources on bringing these antiquities back to the surface will provide a steady stream of income.

Members of the excavation team have located a submerged vault, filled with loot such as enchanted apparel and coins made of precious metals. Focusing resources on bringing these antiquities back to the surface will provide a steady stream of income.

Dense foliage almost completely conceals a dead, desiccated graht-oak - a telltale remnant of a lost Bosmeri settlement. Ferocious predators, perhaps drawn by the lingering magicks of long-dead Greenspeakers, have made their homes in the hollowed-out tree, limiting treasure hunters to the outskirts of the area.

Government bounties on the local predators have encouraged intrepid hunters to eliminate some of the hostile wildlife, in turn permitting a small archaeological team to recover and study valuables from some of the outer parts of the towering graht-oak.

An expanded bounty-hunting program has resulted in the old settlement being almost completely cleared of aggressive wildlife. The relative safety has enticed more scholars to join in the ongoing excavation and examination of the tree and its numerous compartments.

Continued excavations have discovered the personal chambers of the local Tree-Thane, including a vault containing a small fortune in precious gemstones, fur pelts, leather goods and gold coins. A team of mages skilled in Alteration and Restoration have determined that the graht-oak still clings to life, and have been able to revitalize much of the giant tree trunk.

A once illustrious Imperial stone fort languishes, its central keep slowly crumbling while moss turns the masonry stone blocks into a dull shade of green. Petty bandits and smugglers have made this place into a base of operations, and adventurers sometimes return to nearby settlements carrying the belongings of vanquished criminals.

An armed expedition has been sent into the ruins, eliminating the criminal base of operations and selling off the dead criminals' ill-gotten gains at nearby markets. Meanwhile, archaeologists are examining the well-preserved interior of the fort, learning useful information about Cyrodilic architecture.

The excavation team is pushing further into the fort, unlocking previously-sealed chambers containing old Imperial weapons and armor, pottery, clothing and other culturally-valuable personal effects. One of the chambers, flooded with water, appears to be a still-functional cistern.

The excavation team has located and successfully opened up the fort's old catacombs. The expedition's armed contingent has successfully defeated the resident skeletons and wraiths that stalked this hidden chamber, locating a treasure vault with even more valuable materials. The catacombs themselves will provide useful information pertaining to Cyrodilic burial practices.

An old manor complex, once the home of a Breton lord or lady and their servants and serfs, sits abandoned and overgrown with foliage. Treasure hunters occasionally find jewelry and utensils in the immediate vicinity, but warn travelers to avoid the manor itself - it is quite haunted, and the dead walk within.

Intrepid adventurers have been hired to eliminate the undead menace, banishing the zombies, ghosts and other dangerous beings inside the manor. A small group of archaeologists have been examining the safer parts of the complex, turning up the personal belongings of the departed inhabitants.

With the manor completely cleared of any threats, the archaeological surveyors turns their attention to the central compound of the settlement. The manor's private smithy offers a wealth of material goods, but perhaps more importantly, substantial information about traditional Breton forging techniques.

Further examination of the manor complex is turning up all sorts of luxury goods, including fine furniture and works of art that once belonged to the lord or lady of the manor. Some of these items are in good enough condition to sell to collectors for a fat profit, and those that are not still warrant significant study for the bounty of cultural knowledge they provide.

A collection of old buildings lay abandoned, crumbling from ongoing neglect. The area is a magnet for bandit activity, and brave adventurers sometimes venture here, killing the criminal inhabitants and selling off their belongings at market.

A government-funded excavation team, protected by armed guards, has begun excavating the local ruins. While the process is in its early stages, it is already paying off, as small hoards of gold, silver and gemstones have been found.
Some of the buildings at the excavation site have been completely uncovered. Pottery, clothing, weapons, armor and other personal items are being recovered, catalogued, and thoroughly studied.

The excavation team has stumbled upon what appears to be the personal chambers of the local leaders who once dominated the vicinity's political landscape. Chests of gold and jewels, arms and armor, and even works of fine art are being uncovered in the many chambers of the compound.

An imposing Velothi stronghold, monolithic in its construction, sits ominously quiet amidst dead trees and Emperor Parasols. A renegade wizard, guarded by a handful of thugs and Daedra, studies in total seclusion, occasionally producing enchanted trinkets that find their way to local markets.

A government-funded force, contracted to take over the ruined site, is currently skirmishing with the wizard's retinue - and winning, bringing back Daedra hearts and Daedra skin as well as weapons, armor and gold as proof of their victories.

The siege on the Velothi structure is nearly over, with the wizard and all remaining followers retreating to the central chamber of the complex. As the guards secure the adjacent rooms and passages, archaeologists are examining the site and finding excellent samples of Velothi goods, seemingly ignored by the current inhabitants as mundane junk.

With nowhere to go, the renegade wizard has capitulated to the besieging forces, receiving amnesty in exchange for aiding the archaeologists in studying the old complex. The wizard's surviving followers have been conscripted to aid in the excavation, helping to uncover further valuables.

Rotting timbers and collapsed roofs show the advanced decay of an abandoned Orc stronghold. Goblins now call this site their home, skirmishing with travelers and hunters who stray too close to the stronghold's splintered palisades. Some of the goblin raiding parties have been defeated outright, with their equipment sold off to the locals.

Excavators and their armed protectors have been sent to the stronghold with the intention of studying it. As goblin sentries have been felled and their belongings recovered, the archaeologists have been able to study some of the Orcish architecture.

A siege has commenced on the stronghold's longhouse, which is believed to house the goblin chief and the resident tribe's shaman. Further studies of the outlying stronghold are turning up impressive samples of Orcish weapons and armor, and examination of the forge is shedding some light on traditional Orc forging techniques.

The archaeologist's armed escort group has broken into the longhouse and slain the chieftain and shaman. With no tribal or spiritual leadership, the surviving goblins have fled the stronghold, dispersing in every direction. It appears that the goblins were guarding a treasure trove of Orcish artifacts, which will prove both useful in study and valuable for export.

Pure-white stone pillars jut from the earth, the only signs that a majestic Snow Elf community once inhabited this area. Other than the occasional chest full of trinkets and broken pottery, there is little of interest here - though locals swear that there are ruins further below, and denizens dwelling within them.

A small dig site now occupies the ruins' location. Initial excavations show promise - there are surprisingly well-preserved structures underneath the soil - but more armed men and women will need to be hired, as the archaeological team's guards have commenced hostilities with blind, subterranean Falmer inhabitants inside the ruins.

With the aid of well-paid mercenaries, the Falmer are being pushed back further into the dark recesses of the Snow Elf complex. Some chambers have been opened and excavated, turning up Snow Elf weapons, attire and jewelry, and even some texts written in ancient Falmeris.

Following a battle with some heavily-armored spellcasters, it appears that the last of the resident Falmer have been eliminated, and the ruins are safe for further study. Indeed, the dig team has rounded up both Snow Elf and Falmer artifacts, making note of the stylistic parallels that illustrate a clear continuity between the two groups.
A few adornments for the simple shrine, to help make it more visible to those nearby. Questing adventurers and devout pilgrims sometimes find their diseases cured instantly.
The shrine is surrounded by a small structure that stands out in the landscape, attracting visitors in need of healing.
Hiring a full-time healer to attend the wayshrine provides the sick and wounded with an expert in Restoration magicks to tend their ailments.
A beacon of succor, this small complex is home to several healers, priests and other personnel who work full-time to prevent and treat afflictions in [Root.GetName].

Isolated, furnished cells given to the extremely ill while they convalesce. Not only does this lower the chance of others becoming infected with disease, but allows the afflicted to recuperate in comfort and safety.
A small plot of land near the shrine where the local clergy grow produce. Hungry guests are allowed to purchase small portions of the food at below-market prices.
Personal effects of local heroes and religious figures are stored here, attracting pilgrims from far and wide.
A handful of armed zealots have taken residence at the shrine, defending visitors from bandits and brigands.
Heavily-armed crusaders and other religious fighters protect the shrine's inhabitants and inner sanctum, and hunt down criminals and monsters alike.
A plot of land adjacent to the shrine used to grow the alchemical reagents which are essential for restorative potions.
